text:
This is a hidden gem in the area!

At first it looks like just another unassuming nasi lemak econ bee hoon stall, but the food is actually very good!

The nasi lemak basic chicken rice set is priced at $3. It comes with egg, chicken rice, slices of cucumber, sambal and roasted peanuts. It's way cheaper then most stalls, especially the Changi Village ones.

Most ingredients are also 50 cents and a bit more for other bigger ones.

Rice Taste ok, the sambal is kinda dry type and pretty spicy. Might want to ask for more as the auntie gave not too much. The chicken wing is the winner. Very crispy and well seasoned, and not too salty too.

If only the rice is a bit more fragrant this stall will be the top stall in the area. For now the chicken wing is top for me. Even power nasi lemak chicken wings lose to this stall!

Cheap price and good food. Best!

A Culinary Masterpiece

Nestled in the heart of the city, this stall shines as a beacon of culinary excellence. Its standout dish, the chicken wings, is a marvel of flavors and textures. Expertly marinated and cooked to crispy perfection, these wings are a testament to the stall's commitment to quality and passion for food.

The atmosphere is as inviting as the food, with friendly staff and a vibe that captures the essence of traditional hawker culture. Whether you're a local or a visitor, these chicken wings promise a memorable dining experience, embodying the best of what hawker cuisine has to offer.

In essence, this is more than just a food stall; it's a must-visit destination for anyone seeking a taste of authentic, deliciously prepared chicken wings amidst a welcoming setting.

Visited on 22 Sep 2022, just giving this a try so ordered kway teow with chicken patty and fish patty for $3.80.. the kway teow has alot of garlic and spring onion fried into it which is good for people with sore throat or flu ðŸ˜‚ but taste overall is ok

Very good chicken wings. Chilli even better. 5 star.
